Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2008 03:29PM kungfutechgirl wrote: Hi there!  I had my unilateral mastectomy with removal of level one and two nodes 5 days ago. I'm feeling pretty good overall..energy comes and goes.  My left arm (underneath) feels pretty sore and numb, but that's to be expected. I am amazed that I don't feel any pain at all in the incision area (only some discomfort at the two drain sites).  I'm having some swelling under the arm, and I guess that is also to be expected.  I'm glad it's behind me. The surgeon removed 21 nodes, two of which showed cancer. He removed the 2cm tumor and all margins are clear! Hooray! I had neoadjuvant chemo and will now face radiation (and possibly more chemo). I'll know more when we meet with the oncologist Thurs. Hope you're all recovering well! Good luck to those of you facing your surgeries. I am really honestly amazed at how much easier the mastectomy was compared to my C-section in '06! :)
